title: Nasuni Edge Appliance
descriptionMarkdown: The [Nasuni](https://www.nasuni.com/) connector allows you to easily connect your Nasuni Edge Appliance Notifications and file system audit logs with Microsoft Sentinel. This gives you more insight into activity within your Nasuni infrastructure and improves your security operation capabilities.

sampleQueries.description: All events by facility except for cron
sampleQueries.query:
Syslog
            | summarize count() by Facility | where Facility != "cron"

value:
Syslog
   | where TimeGenerated > ago(3d)
       |take 1
       | project IsConnected = true

dataTypes.name: Syslog
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
Syslog
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

customers.name: Nasuni Edge Appliances
customers.description: must be configured to export events via Syslog

instructionSteps.title: 1. Install and onboard the agent for Linux
instructionSteps.description:
Typically, you should install the agent on a different computer from the one on which the logs are generated.

>  Syslog logs are collected only from **Linux** agents.

parameters.title: Choose where to install the agent:

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on Azure Linux Virtual Machine
instructionSteps.description: Select the machine to install the agent on and then click **Connect**.

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on a non-Azure Linux Machine
instructionSteps.description: Download the agent on the relevant machine and follow the instructions.

instructionSteps.title: 2. Configure the logs to be collected
instructionSteps.description:
Follow the configuration steps below to configure your Linux machine to send Nasuni event information to Microsoft Sentinel. Refer to the [Azure Monitor Agent documenation](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-monitor/agents/agents-overview) for additional details on these steps.
Configure the facilities you want to collect and their severities.
1. Select the link below to open your workspace agents configuration, and select the Syslog tab.
2. Select Add facility and choose from the drop-down list of facilities. Repeat for all the facilities you want to add.
3. Mark the check boxes for the desired severities for each facility.
4. Click Apply.

instructionSteps.title: 3. Configure Nasuni Edge Appliance settings
instructionSteps.description: Follow the instructions in the [Nasuni Management Console Guide](https://view.highspot.com/viewer/629a633ae5b4caaf17018daa?iid=5e6fbfcbc7143309f69fcfcf) to configure Nasuni Edge Appliances to forward syslog events. Use the IP address or hostname of the Linux device running the Azure Monitor Agent in the Servers configuration field for the syslog settings.
